alert.note: Alert for Childress (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 4:50PM CDT until May 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lubbock TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River near Childress 10N affecting Childress County. For the Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River...including Childress 10N... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River near Childress 10N. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Cattle grazing in the flood plain are threatened by rising water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 9.2 feet early Tuesday morning. It will rise to 9.3 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM CDT.
